content: frankie s knitted stuff rainbow gnomes this parade of rainbow coloured gnomes is a fun addition to your christmas decorations or you could just knit one for a quick gift the gnomes are knitted in the round using small amounts of dk weight yarn and stuffed with plastic pellets to help them stand up straight you will need … … a somewhat eclectic selection of materials as well as the yarn and needles this pattern calls for toy stuffing plastic pellets a pair of cheap tights a jingle bell and a coin oh and a pair of tweezers yarn and needles i used stylecraft special dk 295 m / 100g for my gnomes and knitted them in the round using one circular 3 mm needle us size 2½ and the magic loop method gauge is not that important but you do want a firm knitted fabric to stop the stuffing showing through you will also need a pair of straight 3 mm needles to knit the beard nose and the brim of the hat each gnome is knitted in two shades of one colour the darker shade for the body and the lighter for the hat you will also need two more colours for the beards and noses i used stylecraft special s hint of silver for the beards and stone for the noses 1 the colours i chose were red orange yellow green blue indigo violet dark claret spice gold green lapis emperor plum kelly proper fuchsia light lipstick clementine dandelion aster green purple purple other bits & pieces the gnomes are first stuffed with a small bean bag sitting on top of a coin for extra stability i made my bean bags with 20g of plastic pellets knotted into a section of a pair of tights you can get lots of bean bags out of one pair of tights the coins i used were 2p pieces which are about 2 5 cm in diameter 1 and the biggest ones i could find well … £2 coins are bigger but they would have turned out to be rather expensive gnomes if i d used those 2 the top of the gnome is stuffed with normal toy stuffing the tweezers are handy for this when you get near to the top of the hat a 12mm bell adds the finishing touch and now for the knitting … the base using the darker colour and the long tail method cast on eight stitches you will be working in the round start by knitting into the front and back of every stitch giving you 16 stitches work the first kf&b with the cast on tail of yarn round 1 knit round 2 k1 kf&b x 8 24 sts round 3 knit round 4 k2 kf&b x 8 32 sts round 5 knit round 6 k3
